Detailed Description

Class CartesianFaceFloatConservativeLinearRefine implements conservative linear interpolation for face-centered float patch data defined over a Cartesian mesh. It is derived from the base class hier::RefineOperator. The numerical operations for the interpolation use FORTRAN numerical routines.

See also:
hier::RefineOperator

Member Function Documentation

int SAMRAI::geom::CartesianFaceFloatConservativeLinearRefine::getOperatorPriority (  )  const [virtual]

The priority of face-centered float conservative linear is 0. It will be performed before any user-defined interpolation operations.

Implements SAMRAI::hier::RefineOperator.

hier::IntVector SAMRAI::geom::CartesianFaceFloatConservativeLinearRefine::getStencilWidth (  )  const [virtual]

The stencil width of the conservative linear interpolation operator is the vector of ones.

Implements SAMRAI::hier::RefineOperator.

void SAMRAI::geom::CartesianFaceFloatConservativeLinearRefine::refine ( hier::Patch &  fine,
const hier::Patch &  coarse,
const int  dst_component,
const int  src_component,
const hier::BoxOverlap &  fine_overlap,
const hier::IntVector &  ratio 
) const [virtual]

Refine the source component on the coarse patch to the destination component on the fine patch using the face-centered float conservative linear interpolation operator. Interpolation is performed on the intersection of the destination patch and the boxes contained in fine_overlap. It is assumed that the coarse patch contains sufficient data for the stencil width of the refinement operator.

Implements SAMRAI::hier::RefineOperator.
